segments.en: “These three kinds of people are found in the world.
The blind, the one-eyed, and the two-eyed.

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa tathārūpaṃ cakkhu na hoti yathārūpena cakkhunā anadhigataṃ vā bhogaṃ adhigaccheyya adhigataṃ vā bhogaṃ phātiṃ kareyya;
segments.en: It’s someone who doesn’t have the kind of vision that’s needed to acquire more wealth or to increase the wealth they’ve already acquired.

segments.pli: tathārūpampissa cakkhu na hoti yathārūpena cakkhunā kusalākusale dhamme jāneyya, sāvajjānavajje dhamme jāneyya, hīnappaṇīte dhamme jāneyya, kaṇhasukkasappaṭibhāge dhamme jāneyya.
segments.en: Nor do they have the kind of vision that’s needed to know the difference between qualities that are skillful and unskillful, blameworthy and blameless, inferior and superior, and those on the side of dark and bright.
This is called a blind person.
Who is the person with one eye?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa tathārūpaṃ cakkhu hoti yathārūpena cakkhunā anadhigataṃ vā bhogaṃ adhigaccheyya adhigataṃ vā bhogaṃ phātiṃ kareyya;
segments.en: It’s someone who has the kind of vision that’s needed to acquire more wealth and to increase the wealth they’ve already acquired.

segments.pli: tathārūpaṃ panassa cakkhu na hoti yathārūpena cakkhunā kusalākusale dhamme jāneyya, sāvajjānavajje dhamme jāneyya, hīnappaṇīte dhamme jāneyya, kaṇhasukkasappaṭibhāge dhamme jāneyya.
segments.en: But they don’t have the kind of vision that’s needed to know the difference between qualities that are skillful and unskillful, blameworthy and blameless, inferior and superior, and those on the side of dark and bright.
This is called a one-eyed person.
Who is the person with two eyes?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa tathārūpaṃ cakkhu hoti yathārūpena cakkhunā anadhigataṃ vā bhogaṃ adhigaccheyya, adhigataṃ vā bhogaṃ phātiṃ kareyya;
segments.en: It’s someone who has the kind of vision that’s needed to acquire more wealth and to increase the wealth they’ve already acquired.

segments.pli: tathārūpampissa cakkhu hoti yathārūpena cakkhunā kusalākusale dhamme jāneyya;
segments.en: And they have the kind of vision that’s needed to know the difference between skillful and unskillful, blameworthy and blameless, inferior and superior, or qualities on the side of dark and bright.

segments.pli: sāvajjānavajje dhamme jāneyya, hīnappaṇīte dhamme jāneyya, kaṇhasukkasappaṭibhāge dhamme jāneyya.

segments.en: This is called a two-eyed person.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasminti.
segments.en: These are the three people found in the world.
those who are blind, with ruined eyes.
the young man’s skilled at piling up money,
From here they go to hell—
And now the two-eyed is explained,
money acquired by their own hard work.
They give with best of intentions,
They go to a good place,
But you should keep the two-eyed close,
